intro: Dubouzetia elegans var. elegans, commonly known as the elegant dubouzetia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to deep purple. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its blooming period occurs during the summer months, making it a notable addition to gardens in suitable climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated for horticultural purposes.
